Name: Restraining dogs in city-owned parks and playgrounds.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to restraining dogs in city-owned parks and playgrounds.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.	Title 18 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 18-107.1 to read as follows:
	§18-107.1  Control of Animals.  The department shall be authorized to promulgate rules relating to the locations, hours, conditions and other circumstances under which dogs may be permitted in any area under the jurisdiction and control of the department without being restrained.
	§2. This local law shall take effect immediately upon enactment.

JH
H:/LS Requests/Yassky - Unrestrained Dogs in Parks - LS # 1781
10/19/06
